Class Form

java.lang.Object
io.mindspice.simplypages.core.HtmlTag
io.mindspice.simplypages.components.forms.Form
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component
public class Form extends HtmlTag
Form component for wrapping input elements. Supports HTMX attributes for dynamic form submission.

CSRF Protection

POST forms should include CSRF tokens to prevent Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks. Use withCsrfToken(String) to add the token:

Form.create()
    .withAction("/submit")
    .withMethod(Method.POST)
    .withCsrfToken(csrfToken)  // Protects against CSRF
    .withChild(...)

HTMX Forms

For HTMX submissions, use withHxPostCsrf(String, String) which automatically includes the CSRF token in request headers.

    • withCsrfToken

      public Form withCsrfToken(String token)
      Adds a CSRF token as a hidden input field.

      When using Spring Security, pass the CSRF token from the controller:

      @PostMapping("/submit")
public String form(CsrfToken csrf) {
    return Form.create()
        .withAction("/submit")
        .withMethod(Method.POST)
        .withCsrfToken(csrf.getToken())  // Spring provides token
        .withChild(...)
        .render();
}

      For other frameworks, generate the token using your security library and pass it to this method.

      Parameters:
      token - the CSRF token value
      Returns:
      this form for method chaining

    • withHxPostCsrf

      public Form withHxPostCsrf(String url, String csrfToken)
      Configures this form for HTMX POST with CSRF token.

      This is a convenience method that combines withHxPost(String) with CSRF token header configuration.

      Parameters:
      url - the URL to POST to
      csrfToken - the CSRF token value
      Returns:
      this form for method chaining

    • withChild

      public Form withChild(Component component)
      Description copied from class: HtmlTag
      Adds a child component to this tag.

      Children are rendered in the order they are added, after any inner text.

      Examples:

      div.withChild(new Header.H1("Title"));
div.withChild(new Paragraph().withInnerText("Content"));
div.withChild(Form.create().addField("Name", TextInput.create("name")));
      Overrides:
      withChild in class HtmlTag
      Parameters:
      component - the child component to add
      Returns:
      this HtmlTag instance for method chaining
